0.text: Partly thanks to new technology, we've become obsessed by the idea of finding an amazing character

9.text: Back in the olden days you made do; you just got together with because their land was next to yours,

14.text: and you're plow perfectly complimented their oxen; it was all pretty practical.

20.text: But now, we're romantics with laptops out to find the ideal fit:

24.text: someone who's beautiful, who totally understands us.

30.text: So many people aren't quite right, but still we keep going; they must be out there.

37.text: That's what the stories have told us since childhood.

40.text: But perfection is, at best, for angels only.

45.text: A perfect seeming partner might appear compatible in so many ways,

50.text: but still we might come to blows over the color of the curtains, tea versus coffee, or children's names.

57.text: The real challenge of relationships isn't to find the perfect match, it's to negotiate the differences without panic or nastiness,

66.text: and stop blowing up perfectly good relationships for mistaken dreams and flawless scenarios.

74.text: Learning to give up on perfection may be just about the most romantic move any of us could make.
